Dear Ms. Wilson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Privacy safeguard
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12211
Section • (1) An agency shall safeguard the privacy of a child and his
Description or her family.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Staff 1 of an agency violated confidentiality.
Investigation The DHHS Director of a local county DHHS was interviewed
via telephone on February 26, 2024. The DHHS Director
reported he had directed the Complainant to file a complaint when
information was obtained that Staff 1 may have violated a foster
child and the child’s family’s privacy. The DHHS Director provided
identification of Staff 1 and Witness A. The DHHS Director
referred me to the Complainant for further information.
Complainant was telephoned on February 27, 2024, and a voice
mail message was left requesting a return phone call.
The Agency Director was interviewed via telephone on
February 28, 2024. The Agency Director was informed of the
compliant at that time. The Agency Director provided the
telephone number of Staff 1.
The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 4,
2024, and March 6, 2024. The Complainant reported Witness A
had informed her that Staff 1 had a history of sending her screen
shots of case information regarding children and families on her
caseload. The Complainant reported Witness A informed her she
is the Godmother of Staff 1’s children and they were friends. The
Complainant reported she asked Witness A to provide her with
screen shots of texts she had received from Staff 1 regarding
children and families on her caseload. The Complainant reported
Witness A refused to provide the information.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on March 22, 2024. Staff
1 is a foster care worker with the agency. Staff 1 reported Witness
A is the Godmother of her children, and they are friends. When
Staff 1 was informed of the allegations she denied she had ever
2

shared any information with Witness A about the children and their
families on her caseload.
Witness A was telephoned on March 28, 2024, a voice mail
message was left requesting a return call.
Witness A was interviewed by telephone on April 8, 2024.
Witness A is a community member and is not a foster parent or a
relative to any foster care case. Witness A reported she and Staff
1 are friends and she is the Godmother of Staff 1’s children.
Witness A reported Staff 1 had a history of sharing information
about children and families on her caseload with her, usually via
texts on cell phones. When asked if she could provide the texts,
she said that might be hard and she would have to do some
searching. Witness A was asked if she could provide a name of a
person that Staff 1 had on her caseload and had talked about with
her. Witness A provided a name of a foster care relative provider
(Relative 1) and a foster child (Foster Child A) that Staff 1 had
talked about recently.
Staff 1 was interviewed a second time via telephone on April
10, 2024. Staff 1 was asked again if she had shared any case
information with Witness A and she denied this. Staff 1 was asked
if she had any knowledge of Relative 1 who Witness A had
identified, as well as Foster Child A. Staff 1 acknowledged that
Foster Child A is on her caseload and resides with Relative 1.
When asked how Witness A would know of Foster Child A and
Relative 1, Staff 1 replied Witness A has spent a lot of time at her
house as they are friends and Witness A could have seen the
name of Foster Child A and Relative 1 on her open computer or
maybe she had seen a file laying around with Foster Child A’s
name on it.
DOCUMENT REVIEW: A review of the case file of Foster Child A
was conducted. The case file confirms that Staff 1 was the foster
care worker for Foster Child A and Relative 1.
Witness A never provided text screen shots of alleged case
information.
Analysis Witness A reported the specific name of Foster Child A and
Relative 1 as people that Staff 1 had spoken to her about. Staff 1
denied she had shared any case information about Foster Child A
and Relative 1 with Witness A. However, Staff 1 acknowledged
that Witness A could have, while visiting her home, viewed her
open computer or the case file of Foster Child A.
3

Staff 1 did not safeguard Foster Child A’s or Relative 1’s privacy
and did not keep confidential information secured and from view of
others.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
